Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: brendabulman
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel with two friends. We found the hotel clean and comfortable. We shared a "triple" room, which was inexpensive. The room had three single beds with adequate space between them. The room although not huge was fine for our stay.The beds were comfortable with fresh linen provided daily. The only issue with the room was the air conditioning was on a winter setting and blew out warm air. The weather was mild and therefore the room was warm. We had to open the windows and had traffic noise until about 2.30am. The staff were efficient and helpful, although lacked a smile, the exception was. Martin the barman, who was charming and very welcoming. The bus/tram stops just outside the hotel, although because there were three of us we used taxis(metered) which were 10-12 euros to the vatican and the spanish steps. Breakfast was much better than expected, with plenty of hot and cold choices. Had a nice meal at a restaurant across the road and around the corner on the viale Gioacchino Rossini, the Taverna Rossini. Overall a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Your average 4* hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: costinul_ala
Reviews.Content: It is definitely an average 4 star hotel by Rome standards. The gym is small. The rooms are not big but clean and not antique the breakfast is satisfying and the service is good. More over you also get free internet in the room which unfortunately is not yet common as free service is Rome. It is worth to mention that is quite noisy being right on the boulevard. So you might want to ask for a room facing the other side. You can get pretty easy down town by bus

Reviews.Title: “A visit to Rome to see the Rugby”
Reviews.Author: Comm09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally placed being just in front of a bus stop. There were frequent buses and trams to take you into the city. However, our visit coincided with the weather conditions (A bizzard) not often experienced in Rome. The hotel was very nice and provided all of the amenities that we required for a short stop over. The only small criticism I could make was that the bar lacked atmosphere that would tempt you to hang around. However, we did given the climate and we were made to feel welcome. The area itself was very good with lots of nice cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Front of a Bus Stop”
Reviews.Author: Kadavis2
Reviews.Content: If you've ever been to Rome you know that public transportation is very important. Well this hotel has a bus stop almost right in front of it. It allows you quick access to the main parts of the city. I took the bus to the Colosseum area and/or the train station stop. I put that out there first because the hotel is not in the "walls" of Rome. It's right outside of them, by the Gardens. The hotel itself is very nice and modern. They are going through a renovation as the desk told us they were bought out by Hilton. There was some really loud noise coming from the room beside us the morning we were checking out. They were completely redoing the room next door. I am not going to mark them down for that because I applaud the effort to upgrade the hotel. The room is very modern and pretty roomy. Be sure to check out the large market (Tigre) across the street. My girlfriend and I went here multiple times to get local Italian food. The prices there are very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “In 2 minds”
Reviews.Author: rubio52
Reviews.Content: The area it is in was really pleasent and only a bus ride away from the main tourist areas, Room was comfortable, clean, pleasant aspect from our room good and we had wifi. Breakfast just right but lifts mind bogglingly slow...... "reception" sour, surly and the women thought they were too good to deal with customers.... "welcome to Rome" flashed through my mind, its just a good job we did meet to some nice people elsewhere or this would have made Rome a bad, experience. Conclusion hotel fine, reception needs new staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quiet and 1 bus away from city centre. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Csmith81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Claridge for 4 nights in January. We arrived late and the gentleman on the bar kindly rustled us up a couple of pizzas. After a stressful delayed flight this was more than a warm welcome! Breakfast each morning was fab, great selection of hot and continental on offer. The waitress was particularly charming with our 1 year old daughter. Literally outside the front door we found a bus/tram stop that took us straight to the colluseum in one direction and to the Vatican in the other. The reception staff were always helpful with giving us directions etc. The pizzas were great too! My only minor complaint is that the room was a little warm for us but I attribute that to me liking a cold bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here and I really like it. Hotel is clean and safe and well maintained. Breakfast is included and kept me going most of the day. Free expresso from the bar during breakfast hours. There is a small sauna and steam room which are nice to use after walking all day. Villa Borghese garden is just down the road - there is a zoo if you have kids. Do visit the Galleria Borghese. It is amazing. The Berninis take your breath away. Buy a ticket in advance. Hotel provides maps and also transit directions to get everywhere. I often walked through the park to the Spanish Steps and beyond. If it is raining, hotel provides umbrellas. Another nice touch. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and value”
Reviews.Author: Cijpaa
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel the day before our cruise and was very pleased with hotel. Very clean hotel. bed very comfortable, we slept like babies. Breakfast was nice also. The girl at the front desk her name Rejoice was excellent, very informative and freindly. We decided to come back for one day after the cruise Again wonderful accomadations, but this time the front desk when we asked for information it was like we were bothering them, Both the gentleman and lady could not put a smile on thier faces. Never told us that we couldnt buy bus tickets on the bus. All in All a great hotel for the value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With Just One "Sour" Note”
Reviews.Author: Albo007
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, modern hotel near the Borghese Museum, a pleasant area, but you will need a bus or a taxi to get to the center of Rome (bus tickets are available at the desk for 1 Euro). We enjoyed our stay with AC that worked well, a pleasant, quiet room, and an excellent mattress for a great night's sleep. The only complaint we had was the refusal of the lazy "gentleman" at the front desk on the evening of October 08, 2011 to verify our fight home when asked (he told us to use the computer in the lobby -- which was in use at the time and difficult to figure out because of the language when tried at a later time). We do not consider that good service and that kind of poor attitude did not fit well with everything else (which was fine) in the hotel. This is a perfect example of how one employee's poor attitude towards service can damage the hard work management has obviously put into the success of this otherwise well-functioning hotel. In fairness, we asked for (and received) the help of a nice young lady at the desk the next day while the same "gentleman" looked on speechless.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gourmandspain
Reviews.Content: On the positive side the hotel is modern and clean, with an attractive room and comfortable bed complete with minibar and flat screen TV showing programmes in a number of languages and it is good value for money if you can get a room for about €160 including breakfast, in a city where hotels are expensive. Factors to take into account though are:- 1. It is out of the centre and the choices are a pleasant but 40 minute walk through the park past the zoo to the Piazza del Populi or the Spanish Steps, a taxi which is around €10 each way, or possibly a long wait for a No. 19 tram for a 15 minute journey at a cost of €1. 2. If you are foolish enough to bring a car, as we did, then parking in the hotel is €20 per day. 3. There is an open air bar at the side of the hotel which provides noise until about 3.30am. There is double glazing and good air conditioning though which will eliminate this noise. 4. The shower runs hot and cold. Overall the service is responsive and efficient, but we were unlucky in that an early call request was not fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: PMD1
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable hotel (beds are very comfortable, rooms are large enough and wifi is available for free) but service is not up to a 4 star hotel (no one willing to help with the luggage, unfriendly staff...). Elavators are so slow and reception desk needs some updating... And location is not ideal to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and unfriendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room directly through the hotel web site. They had a special promotion. I was allocated a very small room. It was one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. There was not even a proper desk - the TV took all the room on the desk. It was not a real promotion. They allocated normal sized rooms to other guests and I paid a little bit less and got a very small room. This was a dishonest promotion as the small size of the room was not mentioned in the promotion. I arrived at 11pm and wanted to get a bottle of water from the minibar, only to find that I wasn't given the key to the minibar. The front desk could not help. They simply said they did not know why I did not have the key. When I wanted to use the safe it did not work either. Again the front desk could not help. The only nice point about the hotel is the breakfast. Pretty good selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Start to a Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JessEdgar99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very lucky to start our Honeymon with a 3 night stay before our Costa cruise at this wonderful hotel! The room was nice, clean, had a great view and free internet. From the moment we arrived at 10am after a 24 hour trip, the staff was amazing. They immediately took our bags and got us checked in and then were able to get us in our room early, so we were able to take a much needed nap before our tour of the Vatican. They were always there to answer questions, call a taxi and one night a gentleman staffer made a wonderful suggestion that we try a local resturant a couple of blocks away and even took the liberty of making us reservations. His suggestion was amazing! The walk over was wonderful and the food at that little place was amazing (I really wish i knew the name of it!) and the female owner was so friendly, kind and suggested amazing foods and wines that complimented the food! I would recommend everybody try this little place if you can figure out the name of it! As for the location of this hotel we were a little bit further out from all the sites but it was a quick taxi ride away PLUS we didn't get all the city noise that we had when stayed near the Vatican on our way from the cruise ship back home. In fact wish we could have stayed here between the cruise and our flight home rather then the hotel we ended up staying at. I read a lot of complaints about not having A/C and I must admit the hotel was very warm but I was also told it was unseasonably warm while were there. BUT we opened the window and were fine. I would recommend anybody to this hotel and look forward to coming back to Rome and staying here again. Thanks you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joys1023
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Very clean and spacious rooms with a balcony. We had a wonderful view. It is a little out of the way but cab ride from Spanish steps to our hotel is about 10 euro which is worth it after a long day of walking. There is an ATM across the street as well as a gelato place with excellent gelato. Everyone was extremely nice EXCEPT for one woman that was working in the morning. She was EXTREMELY RUDE unhelpful. We went out of our way to avoid talking to her. We asked her to call us a taxi and we stood there for a moment waiting for her to say if she was going to or not and she just yelled at us that she would get to it in a moment and she was very busy. She told us to have a seat which we did. Eventually we went back up to ask if she had called and she did not. Another staff member called for us. That was the second and final encounter we had with her. If we had questions we waited until she was gone before asking the front desk. We also witnessed her yelling at another employee. I was just grateful the other staff members were very nice. So if you stay there, stay away from the Italian woman with shoulder length hair....she is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean roooms, good sightseeing base in a good area”
Reviews.Content: The Claridge Hotel is a small distance from the centre, however this was not a problem as the hotel is well served by tram and bus services and reception can also call a taxi for you. You can also buy bus tickets from reception. We took the bus to the Termini which was a good place to start a days tour. The hotel is situated in a great neighbourhood which is well served by good restaurants El Cheppo (I think this is correct) and the Rossini. We dined at both and they were both very good. We also had a meal with room service which was freshly cooked and of good quality. Breakfast at the hotel was very good, fresh fruit, bread, toast, coffee, fruit juice cheese and cold meats; you could not ask for more selection and get a good start to the day. The room were very hot when we stayed and the heating vent only put our warm air, however, that is a personal preference as we prefer it cooler. On arrival the room we were allocated had a leak which meant that the toilet was contantly flushing. The noise was too distracting to sleep. We complained to reception and were immediately moved and the porter helped us with our luggage within five minutes. The beds and pillows were very comfy and we had great nights sleep. The staff were very efficient, helpful and accomodating; even though it was late it appeared as if it was no trouble. Things happen, and it was no drama for us made easier by the helpfulness of the staff. There is an ATM across the road from the hotel which was useful, take care crossing the road as it is busy during the week. The mini bar in the room is very reasonable for bottled water so don't be shy in using this service. There is also a room safe which is useful. The bathroom was very clean and serviced by a hair dryer and lots of good quality towels. The shower and bath were also very clean with a goood pressure shower. There is TV in the rooom with SKY CNN and all the channels so you can keep up with the news if you want to. The reception has a great map available and the staff are very friendly and helpful with advice and guidance. There is a small gym but I didn't use it. This is a great hotel if you want a good base away from the bustle of the city centre. Tips: I booked a tour with a limo company. It was well worth the money as they prebooked our tickets for the Colleseum and the Vatican Museum. This avoided the long queues at both venues which allowed us to maximise our time. They also took us to the other famous locations. The Vatican Museum is fantastic but you need a full day; get the audio guide, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: AwesomeeOpossum
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel: it has wonderful designed rooms, clean soft beds, plasma tv-internet, nice bathroom. Everything is elegant and shiny. It is not at the center but you can take a bus (I bought tickets at reception) and in ten mins you are everywhere you wish to be. I went on an excursion called "Rome by night" and when getting off the tour bus the Italian guide found out I was staying there he said "wow, you are very lucky!". I guess it meant something. I liked breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Great little stylish place in a quiet place just outside the main centre”
Reviews.Author: SophieW5
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff were super-friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. They gave us helpful guides to public transport. We found this to be an ideal spot, it was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle but very easy to get to all the attractions (just 15 mins on tram to the Vatican and 10-15 on bus to Termini station). The hotel even sold the bus and tram tickets. I especially liked the sparkly bathroom and reasonably priced mini-bar! There are restaurants, cafes and supermarket nearby too. I would stay here again when i visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EarthLover19
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very neat and conveniently located near public transportation to reach all key locations at Rome. We visited the hotel at the end of March when temperature was climbing up and there were no A/C or fan and was advised to keep the slide door open, due to overnight traffic we had trouble sleeping. Otherwise the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a little way out”
Reviews.Author: steve_bourne
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Great staff breakfast ok just a little way out for most of the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Very clean, nice area. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: malteseKROS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely recommended. Although it is not exactly in the old city center, it is only 15 mins away by bus from the Termini station which is right in the city center. The hotel is very clean and although the rooms are not very spacious, they are comfortable and nicely finished. Breakfast was also quite good and the staff was friendly. A good option if you want to avoid those ugly old city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Nice Finishes, Good Quality, Slightly off centre”
Reviews.Author: a_traveller_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and of high quality finishes. The rooms are not very big but with all basic needs in place and of good quality. The rooms included wired internet connections, and a basic jacuzzi in shower. No other major facility in hotel except for a small gym, and some meeting rooms. The breakfast was also good, The location is a bit off the centre, north east of Villa Borghese. Still during the day it is very accessible using buses but there are no metro stops near the hotel. The hotel is around 15 minutes by bus away from Stazione Termini from where you can get anywhere in the city or even away from Rome using trains. During the night it is best to get back to the hotel using a taxi - prices are not prohibitive - around 13 EUR from the Pantheon square or Campo dei Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, a bit away from the action”
Reviews.Author: WrldHrtgSighter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my husband for our honeymoon. The hotel itself was everything we could have asked for. The decor is wonderful (modern, but inviting), the room was comfortable and quiet, the staff was helpful, friendly, and spoke English perfectly. The free breakfast was well beyond our expectations. It is located in a nice area, which my husband and I felt safe to walk around in at night. The only drawback was that it is located in a more residential area and didn't have many restaurants nearby. The Sicilian restaurant next door was pretty tasty, as was Taverna Rossini, but don't waste your money at the cafe Hungaria. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: singledingle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Very impressed with the rooms, plenty of space and very comfortable beds. The shower 'contraption' took a bit of working out but once we had it was impressive. Breakfast was excellent, freshly laid out and plentiful. The hotel is a bit out of town but is right on several bus and tram routes. My only complaint would be the randomness of the buses etc. Some days we walked out straight onto a bus, other days had to wait nearly 20 mins for one (or more likely 3!!) to come along. Still, this is not the fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and roomy. Nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: JonandLaura
Reviews.Content: Loved the beds, very comfortable. Rooms nice with ample space, not huge, but nice. Exceptionally clean. Breakfast good. Hotel right down street from tram. Excellant way to travel into inner Rome. Loved the staff. Martin the Bartender a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would be twice the price in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Holidays007
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a 5 day stay at the Claridge & would say all the negative comments are not justified. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful we arrived just as the bar food was finished but the barman made us a lovely pizza for which we were very gratefull The rooms were rather small but sufficient for the amount of time spent in them Don't know if they have been refurbished lately but the bathrooms were immaculate You can get a bus or tram into the centre for 1 euro not far from the hotel as it is too far to walk for some or a taxi costs 12 euros We ate at nearby restaurants as recommended by the Hotel and they were better than in the city centre All in all a very good Hotel that would be twice the price in the city centre

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: castorbtandsharon
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night after a grueling 24 hours in transit. Staff was pleasant, and the room very clean and modern. I would not call it a "design star", but pleasant, none the less. The bathroom was quite attractive, and functional. There is a grocery store across the street, and this was quite nice for a weary traveler. I picked up supplies, and then went to bed. I think this hotel might be an ok location for those with lots of walking energy, or willing to figure out public transportation. There is a metro directly outside. If this hotel was in city center, it would be 2-3 times the cost. So, I think, a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: callmesam
Reviews.Content: The Claridge is in an interesting location but I would suggest staying in the city center to get more from your vacation. The staff at this four star-rated hotel was less than helpful and the room was two star at most. Air conditioning was not turned on yet (not the hotel's issue - it's a government regulation) and since our room was very warm we had to sleep with the window open. It was extremely noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Location”
Reviews.Author: TwinCitiesBernie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from heavy tourist areas in an upscale residential neighborhood. It was clean and comfortable with a good front desk staff. The rooms were small but functional. Get a balcony if you can. There are several local restaurants that are good very close by; Rossinni is one. Trust the hotel staff on this one. There is a grocery store accross the street (and down one level).

Reviews.Title: “REALLY Enjoyed This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: renesanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 5 days of a several-week tour of Italy/Sicily, in late October, 2008, & certainly the BEST was saved for LAST! 'Were immediately impressed with the cleanliness of this 4-star rated gem, friendliness of staff, beautiful double room (fabulous balcony for afternoon relaxation,) & delicious complimentary breakfasts. Staff even opened dining room early just for us on our day of departure! Our double room had 2 twin (firm) beds, lovely furnishings, and complete bath with an awesome shower - filled with amenities. Mini-bar, locking room safe, flat-screen t.v. with available internet (charge) were among other notables. As in most European hotels, the elevator was small, but quite dependable! 'Loved the neighborhood which provided several excellent restaurants (all price ranges,) grocery store (closed on Sundays) across the street; Farmacia & Tabacchi stores only a short walk away. Be sure to try a few doors down: Don Vito's Ristorante Siciliano - for a truly authentic gastronomic experience! They'll treat you like royalty! Don't forget Cafe Ingheria at the corner, for some of the best gelato in Roma. We also purchased fabric (a great deal!) from a lovely little upholstery shop across the street from the hotel. Many attractions were 1/2 - 1 hour walk away from the Claridge. Additionally, both buses and trams passed by the hotel several times an hour. Maps of Roma were available at the desk upon request. Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful on retrieving - luggage which was left in our cab upon arrival! Overall, we loved this hotel: probably the best one we stayed in over the course of several weeks in Italy and Sicily.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Claridge”
Reviews.Author: abrahamwinkleury
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel November for the weekend. The hotel is clean, modern and the staff friendly. The hotel is situated about 40 minutes casual walking from the Spanish Steps and the walk is through the relaxing Villa Borghese Park, passing the Biopark Zoo. Once you get to the Spanish steps most attractions are quite close by. We personally enjoyed the walk every day but some may find it a challenge, in that case public transport is easily accessible from the Hotel. We ate every day at the Taverna Rossini which is 200 metres away and we did not have a bad meal, we thoroughly enjoyed the food there, however we did not find a lot of alternatives within the locality. One problem that did occur in the Hotel was that breakfast is served in the dining area on the ground floor quite close to the reception. On our first morning we were sat down for breakfast when a couple came in and sat down at a table. Within a minute the couple left the dining area without eating and walked out. After a short while it was noticed that a handbag had been stolen from another guest on the table adjacent to where this couple had sat, so be aware at all times. This however could happen anywhere but all in all i would recommend staying here. The Biopark is well worth visiting and is a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, modern, clean”
Reviews.Author: my3sons88
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Claridge in early October for 3days and discovered what a gem this place was. I had booked our room through the hotel website and not knowing what to expect other than a small room. However, our room was modern, spacious and clean as it consisted of a sitting area + a separate bedroom ( w/ king sized bed) overlooking the city. I had booked the junior suite to accommodate our family of 5. Every morning we woke up to the the bells from the nearby church. The staff were very friendly and helpful. All English-speaking. And our children (twin boys aged 3 1/2 and baby aged 2) particularly enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet - adequate w/ hot and cold items. The location is a bit out of the the main city centre/sights, however, neighbourhood is clean and quiet. There's even a supermarket 3 blocks from the hotel. Public transit is convenient, and a taxi ride to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain was approx 12 Eur and takes about 10mins. Highly recommended for travellers whom wish to stay at a quiet place, modern hotel, away from the noisy city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nanamary
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. We enjoyed a leisurely walk on a beautiful Sunday afternoon past the US Ambassador's residence and other mansions through Borghese Park, the Museo of Modern Art, the Tuscan Museum, and the Piazza Popolo, my favorite Piazza so far. We could have easily walked to Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps had we been inclined. The neighborhood provides beauty and convenience with a grocery store and many restaurants across the street and next door. We had a balcony and I think every room had one. The staff was uncharacteristically friendly for Rome. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Outside City Center”
Reviews.Author: JMCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: just spent four nights at the Claridge hotel as part of a Monograms tour. Overall the hotel was very nice - rooms were reasonable sized and clean, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was very good. Only issue is that the hotel is really a 45-60 minute walk from any of the downtown sites (further to the Colosseum area) and you'll quickly find walking in Rome to be very tiring as you are constantly dodging cars and scooters. Several bus lines run near the hotel, so that is an option, but using the buses at night is a challenge since it is difficult to determine where you are and when you should be getting off the bus. However, as long as you are up to doing some walks, or figuring out the buses, then it is a very nice hotel in a good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: jandktrip
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back after staying two days at the Claridge in Rome. The staff was extremely helpful in making arrangements for tours and a taxi to take me to the airport on the day I left. I did an On & Off Bus one afternoon in Rome and took a city bus #52 to the central city to get on. Everyone was very helpful in directing me to the correct locations. The hotel breakfast was absolutely great, fresh fruit, yogurt, rolls, toast, juice, cereal, eggs, meats & cheeses, Italian coffee is strong so I appreciated the machine. The cups are even kept in a warmer. The room is spotless and I wish I had a marble bathroom at home. The supermarket was a great place to get water etc. The hotel even had American style ice cubes!! I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November for three nights prior to doing a cruise. What a wonderful hotel. So clean and fresh looking. My room really looked like I was the very first person to have ever stayed there. I booked it through Expedia for 99 euros per night including breakfast and taxes. The hotel has obviously been recently renovated and now looks fantastic. I had single room 404, a corner room on the 4th floor. New wide screen LCD television with keyboard attached for internet access (small extra charge for internet). Safe in the room. Small balcony. Lots of toiletries. Wonderful shower with multiple heads. Continental breakfast was included and had enough food to keep me going till dinner time. There is a very good (and hot) small sauna and steam room as well as exercise room on main floor. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful. They have a sheet of paper that gives you all the transit information details from the hotel. There is a supermarket across the street. The hotel is located outside the city centre but it is very easy to use public transit. The first day, I walked through the park and went to the amazing Villa Borghese. Well worth a visit. From there, I continued through the park to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Next day, I went to the Vatican and walked up the steps to the top of St. Peter’s Basilica for a fantastic view of the city. Then, to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Lots of expresso and gelato helped sustain me. Recommendations: bring comfortable walking shoes (this is a great walking city), buy a daily transit pass from a convenience store, have dinner at Taverna Rossini close to the hotel at Viale G. Rossini 54. I will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location no problem for walkers”
Reviews.Author: jcbluk
Reviews.Content: We booked this for four nights in October 07. Location: Walking times - Termini station 30 minutes, Colosseum 45, Spanish Steps 35. Bus/Tram to Termini, Colosseum (No. 3) or Vatican (No .19). Taxi from Termini should be around 15 euros. Area - dull, leafy, but above all safe (think Paris 16e, London St John's Wood, Manhattan E 31 - 40 Sts). Eating options - aimed towards business lunches but reasonable choice in the evening, especially the excellent Rossini just round the corner. Numerous tabacchi, news stands nearby. Do not understand other reviewer's complaints about location - very central Rome hotels tend to be small, noisy, expensive and this offers an excellent balance Hotel: Small but modern and stylish. Helpful concierge staff speak fluent English and offer impartial advice. Bar cheap (3 euros for decent double scotch) and well stocked, breakfast is hearty, fresh and with a wide choice - well above par for tourist hotels. A notable benefit is the four hour window for breakfast, catering to both business and leisure travellers. Only negative was the small lifts, those with enormous luggage may have to go up one at a time! Room: Stylish, comfortable, genuine four star by European standards. Excellent glazing and light-proof curtains ensure a decent night's sleep. Those who like thick soft mattresses may be disappointed as the beds are quite firm but still comfortable. Large flat screen TV with Sky, BBC, CNN plus Italian channels. Pay content and minibar were very cheap by normal standards. Shelf in fridge left free for own drinks. Negatives - no iron, toilet flush a little temperamental. Overall: For the moderately seasoned city sight-seer who doesn't need to fall out of bed and down the Spanish Steps - Claridge offers an excellent balance and a great base for seeing the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fair choice”
Reviews.Author: Girish
Reviews.Content: We moved here as a refuge from the abominable Hotel Alexandra and found it to be a refreshing change. At least, this one was clean. It had all the usual amenities that one requires, if not wants. The breakfast offers a limited choice which is one of the few cons. The biggest problem with this hotel remains its location though. It is not close enough to the traditional hot spots in Rome. Despite all this, it still remains a fair choice.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for high quality, modern, service and value”
Reviews.Author: PayForQuality
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Claridge Hotel for 4 nights to celebrate my 50th birthday with a tourist visit to Rome. The hotel is bright, modern, clean with good facilities and service. We paid a reasonable price for a superior room, bed and breakfast. The double bed was larger than king-size, firm and comfortable. The room was well-equipped with sterio plasma screen TV, mini-bar, marbled bathroom with jacuzzi shower. The Reception service was excellent with helpful staff who spoke good English, gave us maps, travel information and ordered taxis quickly. The breakfast had a good range of cereals, breads, eggs, meats, cheeses, teas and coffee and was open 6.30 to 10.30 a.m. The location is outside of the immediate city centre in a good area. We bought day tickets for 4 euros and used buses and trams - we never had to wait more than 2 minutes outside of the hotel for our bus/tram (as directed by the useful hotel information sheet) with generally an interesting 30 minute journey to our destinations. We had absolutely no problems with this hotel and enjoyed the experience. We would strongly recommend if you want a good quality, modern hotel, prepared to pay a reasonable but not excessive price and enjoy planning and exploring to your own arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: omahanetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Claridge as part of a tour package of Rome. I wasn't sure what to expect as I really wasn't able to choose where to stay. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. I booked a single room and the room was small, but was very clean. There was about 12 inches on either side of the bed. The mattress was very firm, but I could live with it. The bathroom only had a shower and the water changed from hot to cold throughout each shower I took, but it wasn't too bad. The bathroom itself was pretty large, though. It took up about half of the room. It had recently been remodeled and it was beautiful. There was also a balcony, that made the room feel a little larger. The only major complaint that I had was that the free internet computer in the lobby was not working. It was broken the entire week that I stayed there. I kept getting the response that the screen is broken with no other explanations or time frames to be fixed. They did have an internet connection in the room, but it was 8 euros a day and I didn't bring my laptop. There was also a WebTV connection, that I did use. It also cost 8 euros per day, but I paid it because I wanted to check emails. It was terribly slow and frustrating to use. You couldn't see the entire screen and couldn't scroll over, but I suffered through it. I didn't pay for each day that I stayed there. I just used it twice. If that was the worst thing, then I was doing quite well. The elevators of the hotel are also very small. I had one suitcase and it barely fit in the elevator with me. I am not a large person. If you have claustrophobia, take the stairs. Good things were the location. It is in a pretty quiet part of Rome. There are several good restaurants in the area, but some of them are pretty pricey. There is a grocery store across the street. The tram/bus stops are pretty much right outside the door. The front desk even sells one way tram/bus tickets for 1 euro. However, if you are going to be in Rome for more than one day, buy a tourist pass from the tobacco shop around the corner. I think they were 12 euros. You can also get these passes from any metro station. Then you will be able to ride the tram and bus as much as you want for four days. You can get to most of the popular tourist sites using the bus/tram or the metro. It's a little intimidating to to ride the bus or tram at first, they do not announce the stops like they do on the metro. My advice is to ask someone what landmarks to look for before you go so you know when to get off. Or you can do what I did a couple of times and just get on a bus or metro and ride it until it reaches the end of the route and get on another one to see where they go. I got to see a lot of Rome this way and it was pretty cheap. The front desk is very good at giving you this information if you tell them where you want to go. They even have general maps of Rome they will give you if you don't have one. Breakfast is included. It was more than I expected. They have a decent selection of pastries and breads. They usually had several types of canned fruit and a couple of different types of fresh fruit. They also had scrambled and hard-boiled eggs and sausages. They do have a small workout facility and sauna, but I didn't use it. After spending each day walking around Rome in the middle of July, the last thing that I wanted to exercise or sit in a hot room. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. I am not sure what the rate is for people who are not with a tour, but I think I got my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well designed hotel, an oasis of calm in a vibrant busy city”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Howker
Reviews.Content: It is a great pleasure to review this beautiful hotel. We loved the Claridge and from our experience can find no fault - from the friendly courteous helpful staff to the minimalist comfortable entrance, the modern breakfast room with its excellent buffet breakfast to the wonderful quiet and spacious room we were allotted on one of the upper floors at the rear of the building. Our beautiful junior suite had a sitting room area, attractive furnishings, a lovely comfortable bedroom with king sized bed, a quiet little sunny balcony, a well equipped marble bathroom with good power shower, bath and jacuzzi. We were here for six days in May and can thoroughly recommend the lovely safe, green area of Parioli within minutes walk of the beautiful Villa Borghese gardens and the excellent Borghese museum and zoo. There is also a very good local restaurant called "Rossini's" very close to the entrance of the hotel and buses and trams take you into the city centre for all the major sights. To be totally recommended are superb lunches at the Aldrovandi Palace hotel and its lovely rose garden, the roof top restaurants, panoramic views and splendid and unforgettable cuisine at the Hotel Splendide and Hotel Eden just a short taxi ride away. The Via Veneto is marvellous for elegant brasseries, shopping and just strolling the avenue. It was a joy to return to this lovely hotel and lovely area after a day's sightseeing in busy Rome. We look forward very much to a swift return and another stay at this splendid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for Cleanliness & Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: TheLedge
Reviews.Content: Got a good €99 a night deal through Venere which is available at weekends because it's a hotel mainly used for business travelers. Very clean, modern, friendly. It's not exactly central but you can get a bus from the Termini which takes about 15 minutes. Its on a bus/tram line that will take you to the Vatican or central Rome easily. I'd definitely recommend this if you're looking for a relaxing hotel in quiet surrounds and you don't want to be ripped off for a poor quality hotel in the centre of Rome. Rome's transport infrastructure is particularly poor and doesnt compare favourably with the likes of London, Paris or any German city. You might find yourself struggling to get on the right bus line so end up going back to Termini to get your connection all the time which takes a while. Having said that Rome is quite walkable as long as you have decent shoes and are relatively fit. Be prepared to queue for anything Vatican related!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel. J O'R Cork”
Reviews.Author: Togher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in mid May 2007 and found it well located (in the embassy district) and well priced (we booked through 1800hotels.ie). It's a bit out from the City Centre, well away from the hustle, but this is what we wanted. Trams & busses pass outside the door to take you to the Centre and to the major attractions. The hotel is very clean & comfortable and the staff are very helpful & friendly. We also got plenty of advice from Martin the barman. Plenty of restuarants nearby especially Rossini's (200 mtrs around the corner), a must for rugby fans. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Claridge hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovvers
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Claridge hotel. Liked the room with small balcony overlooking the back streets. It was clean, staff were helpful and relatively good location (though echo sentiments of other reviewers that Rome is not geared for tourists and so took a while to work out the tram system - its done by street name). Hotel did provide advice on most common sites. They also have tram tickets at reception. The whole day tickets go quickly though so be sure to ask early. Staff recommended good local restaurants and nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. Enjoyed the park with Villa Borghese in it which is not far away from the hotel. Would recommend walking through there to get to centre (end up around Spanish Steps or Piazza Popolo though your feet will be sore by the end of the day. The negatives were the breakfast ok, but limited. The bar was pretty dead at night. The Pinot Grigio was awful! Overall, good value for money and relatively close to Rome city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, well maintained, friendly staff - recommend”
Reviews.Author: suitcasesuperstar
Reviews.Content: After looking at a sample of some of the reviews, we were unsure of what to expect but from the moment we arrived on our short break (3 days in total) we were very pleased. Location is out of the frenetic centre of Rome but transport connections are frequent and easy to use - the bus stops and trams stops that you need are no more than 3-5 min walk away and drop you right by the all the main sites, you also get to see a bit of day to day Rome rather than being in a tourist bubble (if there for 3 days or more buy a pass for 11 euros which gives you unlimited travel on the trams, buses and metro). Hotel was ultra clean and our room was spacious and well maintained, cleaned everyday including a sheet change (ask for a room with a balcony if possible) and the staff were couteous and extremely helpful (ask them for a list of the travel routes of all the sites). Breakfast was plentiful and a good variety of options, (quick tip though ask the staff for coffees i.e. latte or cappucino rather than getting it from the machine as it tastes awful!) Only downsides for us were as mentioned in previous reviews, the air con was not on (we visited in January)and this sometimes made the room quite hot at night, the room service menu was quite limited (but we discovered some great value eating places about 2 minutes walk away -again ask at Reception and they are happy to point you in the right direction). I would reccomend this hotel as a great place to come back to after a busy day sightseeing in the centre of Rome (as it is in a business district it tends to be a bit quieter in the evening) and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Claridge... nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Flossie1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon. Location of the hotel was good, with regular trams and buses running past the hotel every 15 minutes, connecting you to all the sights across the city. However, we had a couple of problems with our room. The air conditioning didn't work at all (as read on a previous review, maybe it has something to do with them turning it off in the cooler months) and made the room quite warm in the evening. The room itself, however, was very spacious and very comfortable. The shower was very small, flooded when having a shower and the door to the bathroom actually hit the wash basin when you tried to shut the door. An excellent restaurant was situated around the corner from the hotel called the, "Taverna Rossini". We had two wonderful meals in this restaurant, staff were friendly and welcoming and the food was fantastic. Was quite reasonable too. Fully recommended! Staff in the hotel were also friendly and helpful. Would recommend for a short break in the city.

Reviews.Title: “ATHEIST EXCURSION”
Reviews.Author: Tearex
Reviews.Content: Bedroom comfortable and spacious.Magnicant bathroom and shower.Ample breakfast and good variety. Helpful and attentive staff. Quiet area at night but plenty of options for eating out. Good bus and tram links going right past hotel door.Very happy to returnand recommend to friends.Excellent value for money. Avoid rip off taxi fares and use public transport links from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip through Globus and was placed in the Hotel Claridge for my Rome stay. I was a little nervous about it after reading these reviews. However, the staff was nice even if they couldn't speak English. They were very helpful at breakfast and during check-in and check-out. The room was incredible. The location is near the embassies and the National Museum of Art. It is within walking distance of a lot. I am glad I did not stay in the middle of the city, as I heard from others about the noise and the smaller rooms and lack of amenities. The hotel is very tastefully decorated in a Scandinavian way. I really liked the marble bath room and the shower had lot of jets, it was a definate upgrade. The linens were luxurious, we had a flat screen plasma TV with Internet in the room- accessible from the TV. We had great lighting and plenty of space. I can't wait to stay at the Hotel Claridge again. I have already suggested it to a friend who leaves next week. There are some cute little places to eat right across the street and the trolley and bus come right outside the front door so you aren't forced to use a taxi, but a taxi to the other side of town was only like 7 Euros. Not bad. I say walk to where you are going then take a taxi back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist decor”
Reviews.Author: Nefeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Claridge Hotel the first three nights of our Honeymoon.We chose this Hotel because of its location and the minimal design.We felt that it was a safer location for our motorcycle than the center yet it was not to far from it.Modern design,everything seemed brandnew.Our room was spacious, very clean, with a comfortable king size bed and internet acces. The bathroom was also very big and with a jacuzzi bathtub. The staff was very polite and helpfull.At night we wanted to avoid the touristic crowd and go out like locals,they gave us great advice.Breakfast was also very good. The price we got from the internet was only 89 euro (now i see it is 200 euro!!). It is a very nice Hotel but if we did not have our own transportation we would probably not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Lilian_Rastignac
Reviews.Content: As it was said previously, Claridge Hotel has a really bad location. Very far from sightseeing places like Piazza di Spagna, Fontana di Trevi, Via del Corso, etc, etc. Staff can't speak english. In addition to this: they are very unhelpfull. Another problem is the shower, it floods the bathroom floor!!! I will not recommend it and, as many others have said, i will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad manners!”
Reviews.Author: 1adder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for a long weekend 20-23 April. The Hotel itself is ok and its location is not too bad, quite convenient for a lovely walk in the nearby park (next to the Zoo) but we found that the one occasion that we wanted information from reception that the young woman on the desk preferred to first talk to a colleague, then answer the phone before dealing with our enquiry, which part way through she broke off to deal with another guest who had interrupted us. Some customer trainning would be worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanorScotland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break in this hotel. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. A very high standard of cleanliness, beautiful rooms and the best bathroom ever, shower was brilliant with jaccuzi jets. We only booked in for breakfast, which was plentiful. The staff were very polite and helpful. The location: a bit out of the centre but a lovely walk through the Borghese Park and only about 20mins. Plenty of buses or trams to take you into the centre if you did'nt want the walk. Would hightly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: CobyPnina
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family in the hotel. Though the rooms are small, they are well kept and we enjoyed the quiet and friendly atmosphere. Though not close to the city center, the trams that run very near the hotel are convenient in easily reaching anyplace in town. I have reccomended this hotel to my friends travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, maintainance and location problems”
Reviews.Author: oriyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very clean and in a pleasant neighborhood. There are indeed tram lines 3 and 19 right outside the hotel which would take you (in about 30 minutes) to the colleseum and Vatican. The rooms had all the facilities (including king size bed) and were perfectly clean. The shower itself was tiny and the shower curtain kept sticking to our back, which is extremely annoying. We had problems with a leaky shower and with hot water coming and going. Also, the airconditioning didn't work at night (because October is not defined as summer) but we couldn't open the window because of the noise of the tram from the street below. The breakfast was standard Italian, which is OK - nothing more. The service was efficient and we had no problems with the English, although with the exception of one person, nobody seemed to try too hard to be friendly. The restaurant accross the corner, Tavola Rossini, is very nice and is highly recommended. Bottom line: I would prefer a place closer to the center next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Claridge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Claridge in Rome for a long weekend with my boyfriend at the beginning of September 2005. The rooms were clean and modern, including the bathroom, which was almost brand new. The showers do completely soak the entire bathroom, but there are 2 towels per person, one bath sheet and one hand towel, so they are plenty big enough. The breakfast is nice and served until a reasonable hour and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. If you approach a member of staff who doesn't speak good english they will go and find someone that does. The only complaint is the location. Although the location is very nice and safe it is a long way from the city centre and it tended to take nearly an hour to get into the city by the time you have waited for a tram. We ended up getting taxis everywhere which really bumped up the price. In retrospect i think we would have been better off paying more for a hotel in the centre and forgoing the taxi/tram rides.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Claridge is a very good hotel in a city where quality accomodation is hard to find. It is stylish and modern, clean and and very well presented. We booked at 95 euro a night, which is very good value for money. Yes - the location is not central, but the trams are very easy to use (you can buy a 1 euro ticket at reception and either take the 3 to the colleseum or the 19 to the Vatican - remember to validate the ticket in the yellow machine as you get on the tram). Nearby resteraunts are good - especially the 'Cresso', which is just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience......”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler444444
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean but in an inconvenient location of Rome. It takes about 30 minutes on the bus to get to the city centre and there are only a few scattered restaurants that are nearby to the hotel. Our BAD experience came with the elevator, which I HIGHLY recommend NOT to use. My boyfriend and I were on our way out of the hotel around 8pm. We were on the second floor. The elevator on the left side of the lobby (there are two to choose from) was the first to respond to our call. It was a very small elevator, which fits a maximum of 4 people. We got in and were on our way when the elevator stopped and the buttons failed to work. The doors did not open. We tried the alarm button and did not hear anything. We tried the intercom phone to the front desk and it was not working. We tried to open the doors with our fingers and managed to get the first set open. We tried for the second set and failed. They did not budge. I started to panic as the elevator was small and there seemed to be no safety buttons working. We did the only thing left to do; we pounded on the doors with our fists and screamed at the top of our lungs for 15 MINUTES. Finally 3 kids heard our cried from the fourth floor and found us. We had the doors opened about 2 cm, which was the only air that was circulating. The kids told us that we were stuck between the first and second floor. We asked them if they could go to front desk and get help for us. One of them did and the other two stayed with us. The third kid came running up the steps breathless and informed us "The front desk lady did not want to come!" Can you believe it?????? What do you do now? After screaming at the top of our lungs for another fifteen minutes, one of the kids ran outside the hotel and took an Italian policeman by the hand and pulled him into the lobby (he did not speak English and the kids that were helping us were from the US). The policeman came in to speak with front desk. After 30 minutes, we are not sure of all of the exact details but the front desk lady came up to us along with the janitor. The elevator was getting very, very hot; we were dripping from the lack of air and temperature. We were running out of air. They informed us that the elevator technician was on his way. I panicked, as the situation was getting worse. The power went out for a few seconds and it was pitch black. The power went on. After 45 minutes the elevator technician came. At this point I was asking them to cut us out of the elevator, anything to get us out. The technician came and open the doors ad we climbed out of the elevator between two floors. The kids later told us that the elevator had been broken all day, but the hotel did not put a notice on the elevator it was still responding to the call button. Others said the elevator had been acting strange all day. No one from the hotel came to speak to us, or apologized. We saw the manager on our last day, and nothing was said. I must say a huge THANK YOU to the American kids that helped us out. I hope that one day you read this and see how thankful we were to you. You three handled the situation much better then anyone else. You kept us calm and updated us. You ran around for us trying to find help. We tried to thank you in person but I believe that you had already left as we did not see you again. Thank you! The hotel was clean and well kept. The rooms were very nice but the elevator experience was awful. The safety features did not work and the staff did not come to tell us if they even knew we were stuck or that help was on the way for 30 minutes. The situation could have been handled much better. Needless to say that we spent the next 10 days of our vacation taking the stairs at every hotel we stayed at. So overall, if you do stay at this hotel, do not use the elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on Viali Liegi (a business district, quiet at the weekends) which is very close to the Villa Borghese. (A beautiful park with botanical gardens, a small lake and a zoo) If you like to walk, you can stroll through the Villa Borghese to the Piazza del Popolo and on into town in about 30 minutes or cut through to the Piazza di Spagna in less time. Trams stop right outside the hotel for the less adventurous which go to either The Colosseo or The Vatican. With regards to the Hotel; it's nice, clean and well presented, although the staff can be little manic. (this IS Italy!) If you have booked a suite or similar, be careful that you don't get palmed off with a standard double, they tried it on us but as soon as I showed my booking form, we changed rooms to a beautiful suite with the biggest plasma screen I have ever seen! All in all a great holiday in a nice location. Some of the restaurants around the Hotel are very nice and a lot less expensive than eating in town!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms, Decent location..”
Reviews.Author: carson78
Reviews.Content: First time in Italy, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat! It may not be right in the "hustle" and "bustle" of the city, but what a better way to discover Rome! It's just a couple blocks north of the ZOO and the beautiful Borgese Gardens. The rooms are indeed tiny, but very comfortable and extremely clean (cleanliness is of my most important concern in any hotel,.. cost,.. last). I loved our private balcony and the large bathroom, bigger than most in the states...just remember your own washcloth! Front counter staff was very friendly and helpful, although English must not be too high on their priority list. It just took a little more time for the two translations, but I guess, who's the guest in their country??? I would definatley stay here again, and would highly recommend it to anyone who would like to explore the streets of Rome by foot!!
